body:
Comment 7 by **uayars**: 
Well, ran into this new awesome feature just now. Heh. Minor update, 4.8.1 -> 4.8.2,
whaddya know...

Anyway, the online documentation at
http://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gccgo/C-Type-Interoperability.html says that "A pointer to
a Go function is equivalent to a pointer to a C function when the functions have
equivalent types." It also says so in gcc/go/gccgo.texi in the latest trunk at the time
of writing. Perhaps this should be updated, since they are no longer equivalent.
